app.name: DiscMap
app.tagline: Create beautiful disc golf course maps

home.title: Your Courses
home.createFirst: Create your first course to get started

flightLine.editHint: Drag nodes to adjust. Click + to add nodes.

toolbarDesc.select: Click to select and edit features. Drag to move them.
toolbarDesc.tee: Click on the map to place a tee pad. Each tee can have its own color.
toolbarDesc.basket: Click on the map to place a basket (target).
toolbarDesc.flightLine: Click on a tee or dropzone, then click on a basket to draw a flight line. You can add nodes later.
toolbarDesc.flightLineStep1: Step 1: Click on a tee or dropzone to start the line
toolbarDesc.flightLineStep2: Step 2: Click on a basket to complete the line
toolbarDesc.obZone: Click to draw an out of bounds zone. Double-click to finish.
toolbarDesc.fairway: Click to draw a fairway area. Double-click to finish.
toolbarDesc.dropzone: Click on the map to place a dropzone marker.
toolbarDesc.dropzoneArea: Draw the fairway area - everything outside will be OB. Double-click to finish.
toolbarDesc.obLine: Draw an OB boundary line. Green side is fairway, red side is OB. Double-click to finish.
toolbarDesc.mandatory: Click to place a mandatory. Scroll on it to rotate the arrow direction.
toolbarDesc.annotation: Click to add a text annotation. Edit text and style in the properties panel.
toolbarDesc.infrastructure: Draw terrain areas (forest, water, etc.). Select type from dropdown, then draw polygon. Double-click to finish.
toolbarDesc.path: Draw a path line. Click to add points, double-click to finish. Adjust stroke width in properties.

editor.clickToSelect: Click on a feature to edit its properties

style.teeColorHint: Individual tees can have custom colors set in their properties.
style.flightLineColorHint: Flight lines inherit color from their starting tee/dropzone.

layers.showAllHolesHint: Show features from all holes, not just the active one

import.confirmTitle: Import will switch to new course

terrain.hint: Draw terrain areas using the polygon tool after selecting a terrain type from the toolbar.
terrain.exportHint: Theme will be applied when exporting SVG maps.
terrain.defaultTerrainHint: This terrain will fill the entire map background when exporting.

terrain.layer1: Default terrain fills the entire background
terrain.layer2: Drawn terrain polygons appear on top
terrain.layer3: Game features (tees, baskets, etc.) are on top

mobile.title: Desktop Only
mobile.description: DiscMap is designed for desktop browsers with larger screens. Please open this app on a computer for the best experience.
mobile.features: The course editor requires precise mouse control and a wider viewport to work with map features effectively.

welcome.title: Welcome to DiscMap
welcome.description: Create professional disc golf course maps with satellite imagery, custom markers, and beautiful SVG exports. Let's take a quick tour of the key features.

map.title: Your Canvas
map.description: This is where your course comes to life. Pan by dragging, zoom with scroll wheel or pinch gestures. The satellite imagery helps you trace real-world features accurately.
map.tip: Pro tip: Hold Ctrl while dragging to rotate the map view

toolbar.title: Drawing Tools
toolbar.description: Everything you need to build your course. Place tee pads, baskets, and mandatory markers. Draw flight lines, OB zones, and terrain features. Each tool shows helpful hints when selected.

sidebar.title: Course Management
sidebar.description: Manage holes, edit feature properties, customize colors, and control layer visibility. Click on the course name to rename it. Switch between tabs to access different editing panels.

export.title: Export Your Work
export.description: When you're ready, export your course as a beautiful SVG map. Choose from full course layouts or individual hole pages. Add terrain backgrounds, compass roses, and scale bars for a professional finish.

complete.title: You're All Set!
complete.description: Start by placing a tee pad and basket on the first hole. Draw a flight line between them to see the distance. Your work auto-saves, so you can close the browser and pick up where you left off.
